title.narrative: HACT ACTIVITIES

description.narrative: Increased capacity of partners to conduct Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers (HACT) assurance activities for effective and efficient delivery of programme results by end December 2017, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Environmental Sustainability, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Premises and Security

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTORATE OF PLANNING AND INFORMA MOHS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased capacity of partners to conduct HACT assurance activities for effective and efficient delivery of programme results byend December 2017

description.narrative: HACT compliance remained an office priority and standard agenda item for Country Management Team (CMT) and Programme Group meetings, ensuring that the capacity of staff and partners continued to increase. To ensure oversight over effective delivery of programme results, the county office conducted over 177 per cent (223 out of 126) of required programme monitoring visits. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
